verses.verse: אָ֚נָה <WH575> 'A-nah Where הָלַ֣ךְ <WH1980> ha-Lach gone דּוֹדֵ֔ךְ <WH1730> do-Dech, Whither is thy beloved הַיָּפָ֖ה <WH3303> hai-ya-Fah O thou fairest בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים <WH802> ban-na-Shim; ess אָ֚נָה <WH575> 'A-nah Where פָּנָ֣ה <WH6437> pa-Nah turned aside דוֹדֵ֔ךְ <WH1730> do-Dech, has your beloved וּנְבַקְשֶׁ֖נּוּ <WH1245> u-ne-vak-Shen-nu ;that we may seek עִמָּֽךְ׃ <WH5973> 'im-Mach. with

דּוֹדִי֙ <WH1730> do-Di My beloved יָרַ֣ד <WH3381> ya-Rad is gone down לְגַנּ֔וֹ <WH1588> le-gan-No, into his garden לַעֲרוּג֖וֹת <WH6170> la-'a-ru-Got to the beds הַבֹּ֑שֶׂם <WH1314> hab-Bo-sem; of spices לִרְעוֹת֙ <WH7462> lir-'Ot to feed בַּגַּנִּ֔ים <WH1588> bag-gan-Nim, in the gardens וְלִלְקֹ֖ט <WH3950> ve-lil-Kot and to gather שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <WH7799> Shoo-shan-Nim. lilies

אֲנִ֤י <WH589> 'a-Ni I am לְדוֹדִי֙ <WH1730> le-do-Di I [am] my beloved's וְדוֹדִ֣י <WH1730> ve-do-Di and my beloved לִ֔י Li, הָרֹעֶ֖ה <WH7462> ha-ro-'Eh [is] mine he feedeth בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <WH7799> bash-sho-shan-Nim. among the lilies ס sa-Mek

יָפָ֨ה <WH3303> ya-Fah Thou [art] beautiful אַ֤תְּ <WH859> 'at you רַעְיָתִי֙ <WH7474> ra'-ya-Ti O my love כְּתִרְצָ֔ה <WH8656> ke-tir-Tzah, as Tirzah נָאוָ֖ה <WH5000> na-Vah comely כִּירוּשָׁלִָ֑ם <WH3389> ki-ru-sha-Lim; as Jerusalem אֲיֻמָּ֖ה <WH366> 'a-yum-Mah terrible כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃ <WH1713> kan-nid-ga-Lot. as [an army] with banners

הָסֵ֤בִּי <WH5437> ha-Seb-bi Turn away עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH5869> 'ei-Na-yich thine eyes מִנֶּגְדִּ֔י <WH5048> min-neg-Di, for שֶׁ֥הֵ֖ם <WH1992> she-Hem from me for they הִרְהִיבֻ֑נִי <WH7292> hir-hi-Vu-ni; have overcome שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ <WH8181> sa'-reCh me thy hair כְּעֵ֣דֶר <WH5739> ke-'E-der [is] as a flock הָֽעִזִּ֔ים <WH5795> ha-'iz-Zim, of goats שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ <WH1570> sheg-gal-Shu that appear מִן־ <WH4480> min- from הַגִּלְעָֽד׃ <WH1568> hag-gil-'Ad. from Gilead

שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ <WH8127> shin-Na-yich Thy teeth כְּעֵ֣דֶר <WH5739> ke-'E-der [are] as a flock הָֽרְחֵלִ֔ים <WH7353> ha-re-che-Lim, of sheep שֶׁעָל֖וּ <WH5927> she-'a-Lu which go up מִן־ <WH4480> min- up הָרַחְצָ֑ה <WH7367> ha-rach-Tzah; from the washing שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ <WH3605> shek-kul-Lam All מַתְאִימ֔וֹת <WH8382> mat-'i-Mot, whereof every one beareth twins וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה <WH7909> ve-shak-ku-Lah and [there is] not one barren אֵ֥ין <WH369> 'ein one בָּהֶֽם׃ ba-Hem.

כְּפֶ֤לַח <WH6400> ke-Fe-lach As a piece הָרִמּוֹן֙ <WH7416> ha-rim-mOn of a pomegranate רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ <WH7541> rak-ka-Tech, [are] thy temples מִבַּ֖עַד <WH1157> mib-Ba-'ad within לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃ <WH6777> le-tzam-ma-Tech. thy locks

שִׁשִּׁ֥ים <WH8346> shish-Shim There are threescore הֵ֙מָּה֙ <WH1992> hem-mah There מְּלָכ֔וֹת <WH4436> me-la-Chot, queens וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים <WH8084> u-she-mo-Nim and fourscore פִּֽילַגְשִׁ֑ים <WH6370> pi-lag-Shim; concubines וַעֲלָמ֖וֹת <WH5959> va-'a-la-Mot and virgins אֵ֥ין <WH369> 'ein without מִסְפָּֽר׃ <WH4557> mis-Par. without number

אַחַ֥ת <WH259> 'a-Chat is [but] one הִיא֙ <WH1931> hi he יוֹנָתִ֣י <WH3123> yo-na-Ti My dove תַמָּתִ֔י <WH8535> tam-ma-Ti, my undefiled אַחַ֥ת <WH259> 'a-Chat she [is] the [only] one הִיא֙ <WH1931> hi is her לְאִמָּ֔הּ <WH517> le-'im-Mah, of her mother בָּרָ֥ה <WH1249> ba-Rah she [is] the choice הִ֖יא <WH1931> hi who לְיֽוֹלַדְתָּ֑הּ <WH3205> le-yo-lad-Tah; [one] of her that bare רָא֤וּהָ <WH7200> ra-'U-ha saw בָנוֹת֙ <WH1323> va-nOt her The daughters וַֽיְאַשְּׁר֔וּהָ <WH833> vay-'ash-she-Ru-ha, her and blessed מְלָכ֥וֹת <WH4436> me-la-Chot her [yea] the queens וּפִֽילַגְשִׁ֖ים <WH6370> u-fi-lag-Shim and the concubines וַֽיְהַלְלֽוּהָ׃ <WH1984> Vay-hal-Lu-ha. and they praised ס sa-Mek

מִי־ <WH4310> mi- Who זֹ֥את <WH2063> zot that הַנִּשְׁקָפָ֖ה <WH8259> han-nish-ka-Fah Who [is] she [that] looketh forth כְּמוֹ־ <WH3644> ke-mov- like שָׁ֑חַר <WH7837> Sha-char; as the morning יָפָ֣ה <WH3303> ya-Fah fair כַלְּבָנָ֗ה <WH3842> chal-le-va-Nah, as the moon בָּרָה֙ <WH1249> ba-Rah clear כַּֽחַמָּ֔ה <WH2535> ka-cham-Mah, as the sun אֲיֻמָּ֖ה <WH366> 'a-yum-Mah [and] terrible כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃ <WH1713> kan-nid-ga-Lot. as [an army] with banners ס sa-Mek

אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- into גִּנַּ֤ת <WH1594> gin-Nat into the garden אֱגוֹז֙ <WH93> 'e-goyZ of nuts יָרַ֔דְתִּי <WH3381> ya-Rad-ti, I went down לִרְא֖וֹת <WH7200> lir-'ot to see בְּאִבֵּ֣י <WH3> be-'ib-Bei the fruits הַנָּ֑חַל <WH5158> han-Na-chal; of the valley לִרְאוֹת֙ <WH7200> lir-'Ot [and] to see הֲפָֽרְחָ֣ה <WH6524> ha-fa-re-Chah flourished הַגֶּ֔פֶן <WH1612> hag-Ge-fen, whether the vine הֵנֵ֖צוּ <WH5132> he-Ne-tzu budded הָרִמֹּנִֽים׃ <WH7416> ha-rim-mo-Nim. [and] the pomegranates

לֹ֣א <WH3808> lo not יָדַ֔עְתִּי <WH3045> ya-Da'-ti, Or ever I was aware נַפְשִׁ֣י <WH5315> naf-Shi my soul שָׂמַ֔תְנִי <WH7760> sa-Mat-ni, made מַרְכְּב֖וֹת <WH4818> mar-ke-Vot me [like] the chariots עַמִּי־ <WH5971> 'am-mi- people נָדִֽיב׃ <WH5081> na-Div. of my noble

שׁ֤וּבִי <WH7725> Shu-vi Return שׁ֙וּבִי֙ <WH7725> shu-vi return הַשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית <WH7759> hash-Shu-lam-Mit, O Shulamite שׁ֥וּבִי <WH7725> Shu-vi return שׁ֖וּבִי <WH7725> Shu-vi return וְנֶחֱזֶה־ <WH2372> ve-ne-che-zeh- that we may look בָּ֑ךְ Bach; מַֽה־ <WH4100> mah- Why תֶּחֱזוּ֙ <WH2372> te-che-Zu upon thee What will ye see בַּשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית <WH7759> bash-Shu-lam-Mit, the Shulammite כִּמְחֹלַ֖ת <WH4246> kim-cho-Lat the dance הַֽמַּחֲנָֽיִם׃ <WH4264> Ham-ma-cha-Na-yim. of two armies
